en.purpose: To determine the clinical T, N, and M categories and the corresponding TNM stage group for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of non-head and neck skin, according to UICC 8th edition criteria.
en.use:
Use to classify cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) of the skin (non-head and neck region, excluding eyelid, perianal, vulva and penis) by selecting the appropriate clinical TNM categories:
- Clinical T category (Tx, T0, Tis, T1, T2, T3, T4a, T4b), based on tumour diameter and defined high-risk local extension criteria.
- Clinical N category (Nx, N0, N1, N2, N3), based on regional lymph node involvement and nodal metastasis size/distribution.
- Clinical M category (M0, M1), based on presence of distant metastasis (including contralateral nodal disease where applicable in UICC8 definitions for non-head and neck skin).

The guideline then derives the TNM stage group (Stage 0-IVB) from the selected TNM categories using the UICC8 stage grouping table.
en.misuse: Not to be used for TNM classification of head and neck skin cancer, eyelid skin cancer, or cutaneous SCC in perianal, vulvar, or penile sites, as these have different UICC8 definitions and stage groupings.

other_details.en: A structured guideline used to assign the clinical Tumour-Node-Metastasis (TNM) categories and stage grouping for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) of the skin excluding head and neck region and eyelid, according to the UICC 8th edition definitions.
